text: Ask around the lobby for information and wait for Dan Heng

title: Mission Description
content: Meanwhile, you, the cowboy who is a little late to the party, bring unfortunate news to Dan Heng andPom-Pomwho have stayed guard aboard theExpress... There is a strong chance that theCrewmembers who have entered the dream are in danger, because anEmanatorofNihilityis roaming the Dreamscape. You quickly succeed in convincing Dan Heng to accompany you into the Dreamscape and provide assistance, but run into a serious setback as you enter the hotel lobby: Due to strict hotel regulations, you are forbidden from enteringPenacony.The astute Dan Heng seems to notice something out of the ordinary and suggests that he goes ahead to investigate alone. You wholeheartedly agree with his view and suggest splitting up to reassure him... Now, the instincts you developed over your many years of being exposed to dangerous situations are telling you that as you have time on your hands, perhaps collecting some information couldn't hurt.

text: 10 system hours until Charmony Festival - The Reverie Hotel (Reality)

speaker: Alley
line: Welcome to the Reverie Hotel . How may I help you?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Greetings. We're the Nameless from the Astral Express, and we'd like to check in.

speaker: Alley
line: The Astral Express? But I thought...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Yes, my companions already checked in. My name is Dan Heng, and I believe my personal information is recorded in your system.

speaker: Alley
line: I see, but your companions said you wouldn't be coming due to a change of plans.

speaker: Boothill
line: Hah! Now the plans have changed again!

speaker: Alley
line: And you are...?

speaker: Boothill
line: Me? I'm Pom-Pom, a new Nameless who's also with the Astral Express.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...He's my fellow Trailblazer. We responded to The Family's invitation before he boarded the Express, so he wasn't registered in your system. Is it possible to accommodate him as well?

speaker: Alley
line: Oh, I see! Another one of the Nameless had a similar situation. Seems like a lot of people are joining the Trailblaze these days.

speaker: Alley
line: Since there is a precedent, it shouldn't be a problem. Just give me a second to contact your companions...

speaker: Alley
line: ...I'm sorry, dear guests, but it seems I'm unable to reach the other members of the Astral Express.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What do you mean by "unable to reach" them?

speaker: Alley
line: My apologies. This is the first time I've encountered a situation like this. However, the system indicates that those guests are still in the Dreamscape.

speaker: Boothill
line: ...How about this? Give me their room number, and we'll go check on them ourselves.

speaker: Alley
line: I'm afraid that's not possible. I need to verify both of your identities before I can share any guest information.

speaker: Boothill
line: How about you just wake up someone? Let's say... Welt?

speaker: Alley
line: I'm sorry, but there are strict rules regarding forced awakening — it cannot be done without the proper clearance.

speaker: Boothill
line: So nothing works, huh? What's your solution then? Are you saying we sleep here, at the reception?

speaker: Alley
line: Please be patient. We need to contact your companions in order to confirm your identities...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: And now it seems you need to confirm our identities before you can contact our companions.

speaker: Alley
line: It seems so.

speaker: Boothill
line: Fudge! Look, nothin' personal, but if you can't handle this, go find someone else who can, okay?

speaker: Alley
line: Please calm down, dear guests! I do recall that Mr. Sunday, the Oak Family Head, personally handled this issue earlier. Please wait a moment while I contact him.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I don't think she's trying to give us a hard time. She really just doesn't know what to do.

speaker: Boothill
line: I have a bad feeling about this. You tried to contact them on the Express earlier, but they didn't respond.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Something doesn't seem right. I need to leave for a moment. You can stay here with the receptionist.

speaker: Boothill
line: Sure thing — just don't keep me waiting forever.

speaker: Boothill
line: (Dan Heng seems pretty worried about his companions. I should give him some space. Stressing out about it won't help anything.)

speaker: Boothill
line: (This place is too big... I better not wander too far in case he can't find me later.)

speaker: Coty
line: Greetings, I'm Coty of the Bloodhound Family , Head of Security for the hotel. How may I assist you?

speaker: Boothill
line: Hello! So, there's something I wanted to ask about... I've been hearing some unsettling rumors about certain incidents that might affect the Charmony Festival...

speaker: Boothill
line: Do you think there's anything to be worried about? I've traveled all the way from the Hyai'i Federation , and I don't want my trip to be ruined!

speaker: Coty
line: Umm... what do you mean?

speaker: Boothill
line: Wait, you haven't heard?

speaker: Coty
line: I'm not sure where you heard those rumors, but they're completely baseless. I can assure you, as a representative of the Bloodhound Family, that everything is going smoothly for the Charmony Festival.

speaker: Coty
line: At present, all the Families are focused on making sure the festival starts on time. Even the Dreammaster himself has arrived. So don't worry. Your trip won't be in vain.

speaker: Boothill
line: Ah, that's a relief to hear.

speaker: Boothill
line: (She doesn't appear to be acting. So it seems that even the hotel staff are out of the loop.)

speaker: Coty
line: Please be patient as you await the festival. The Family will spare no effort to ensure your satisfaction.

speaker: Jno
line: The Charmony Festival is about to start! I'm so excited!

speaker: Boothill
line: Hey, are you guys here for the Charmony Festival too?

speaker: Jno
line: Well, I didn't come all the way here specially for the festival. Honestly, I don't really even know what it's about, but I heard it's a lot of fun.

speaker: Sabrina
line: Well, back in my homeworld, Anaria, we have festivals like that all the time. My dad threw me a birthday party one time that was just as extravagant as the Charmony Festival.

speaker: Jno
line: Oh, come on! The Charmony Festival is a once-in-an-Amber-Era event. How can a birthday party compare?

speaker: Boothill
line: Well, you never know, right? Maybe on her world birthdays only happen once an Amber Era?

speaker: Boothill
line: Anyway, let's forget about that. Have you heard about the... uh, unsettling things happening in the Dreamscape?

speaker: Jno
line: Unsettling things? What could possibly go wrong? It better not ruin the Charmony Festival. I've been looking forward to it!

speaker: Sabrina
line: Relax, with a big event like this, there's bound to be lots of gossip and rumors. Don't worry. If anything does happen, The Family will be on top of it.

speaker: Boothill
line: Oh! That's a relief! I didn't come all this way to see the festival go down the drain!

speaker: Boothill
line: (Well, looks like I won't get any fudgin' clues outta these two — they're clueless.)

speaker: Sabrina
line: Surely there'll be a lot of celebrities at the Charmony Festival. It's a great opportunity to make some valuable connections.

speaker: Jno
line: Don't enter the dream with such a utilitarian agenda!

text: (After talking to both Sabrina and Coty)

speaker: Boothill
line: Back already?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Hasn't she returned yet?

speaker: Boothill
line: Nope. I'm starting to wonder if sending her to contact Sunday was a good idea.

speaker: Boothill
line: Neither the staff nor the guests seem to know anything about what's happening in the Dreamscape, and wherever we go, all we see is people enjoying themselves... Definitely not a good sign.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I agree. Another unusual thing is that the Oak Family is supposed to be in charge of organizing the council and managing everything inside and outside the Dreamscape. However...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I walked around the hotel but didn't meet a single member of the Oak Family on such an important day.

speaker: Boothill
line: Well I'll be forked... if I remember correctly, the head of the Oak Family is that Sunday guy, right?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We shouldn't linger here too long. Let's go back to the Express for now.

speaker: Boothill
line: Not so fast. Have you ever robbed the IPC, bro? If you run away now, everyone will be chasing after you.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Are you suggesting we sit here and do nothing?

speaker: Boothill
line: I wouldn't say "do nothing," but let's stay put for now. Even if The Family has ulterior motives, they couldn't have anticipated us showing up here. We're the surprise factor for them.

speaker: Boothill
line: They don't want to attract unwanted attention from certain outsiders, so they won't do anything reckless... See? The IPC lackeys are keeping a close eye on this hotel.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...If I were a Family member, I'd find an official excuse and keep the surprise factors here. If we just wait here, that would be like walking into their trap.

speaker: Boothill
line: Of course, we don't need to walk into their trap. I gave a backup plan to the Memokeeper. If it turns out we won't be allowed to enter the Dreamscape, she'll order a drink for me in the VIP Lounge at the hotel in reality.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: A secret signal?

speaker: Boothill
line: That's right.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: A concrete object can indeed help the Memokeeper establish a connection with you... but Boothill, if you have more back-up plans in the future, I hope you'll let me know in advance.

speaker: Boothill
line: I'm sorry, but it's one of my quirks. I have too many unreliable friends, and if I reveal that I have backup plans, things can... things can go awry. And that would leave all backup plans completely useless.

title: Step Description
content: Meanwhile, you, the cowboy who is a little late to the party, bring unfortunate news to Dan Heng and Pom-Pom who have stayed guard aboard the Express... There is a strong chance that the Crew members who have entered the dream are in danger, because an Emanator of Nihility is roaming the Dreamscape. You quickly succeed in convincing Dan Heng to accompany you into the Dreamscape and provide assistance, but run into a serious setback as you enter the hotel lobby: Due to strict hotel regulations, you are forbidden from entering Penacony.You and Dan Heng reach a consensus: Whether this is reality or a dream, nothing about Penacony in its current state can be described as "normal." Fortunately, you always keep a backup plan ready for yourself (though it may not always lead to good things...) It's time for you to use your "street smarts"!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: How do we get into the VIP lounge?

speaker: Boothill
line: This is where my street smarts come into play.

speaker: Boothill
line: You're the lobby manager, right?

speaker: Dennis
line: Yes, I am. How may I assist you?

speaker: Boothill
line: We're the Nameless from the Astral Express! We wanted to check in, but there's something wrong with your system! The lady at the front desk said she would contact the manager, but now she's nowhere to be found!

speaker: Boothill
line: We've been waitin' here forever, without any food or water! What the fork, man? Is this how The Family treats its guests?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Is this your idea of "street smarts"? Starting an altercation?

speaker: Boothill
line: It's called "standing up for your rights."

speaker: Dennis
line: I apologize for the inconvenience. Please wait while we try to contact Mr. Sunday. I'll arrange two premium seats in the VIP Lounge, so you can rest there while you wait.

speaker: Boothill
line: See? Just like that.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Just... just don't call yourself a Nameless next time.

text: Take a seat in the VIP Lounge drinks table

title: Step Description
content: You used your "street smarts" to win your deserved rights. That poor lobby manager crumbled in the face of your intimidation tactics and organized refreshments for you in the VIP lounge... Though it may look like all they have offered is thoroughly insufficient emotional compensation, you know this is just one part of your backup plan... What now? Let's pray that things can go a little more smoothly from here.

speaker: Boothill
line: Wow! This bar is something else — certainly worthy of the Planet of Festivities.

speaker: Anderson
line: Good evening, gentlemen.

speaker: Boothill
line: Hey... I have an order for a bottle of Asdana's White Oak . Can you help us find it?

speaker: Anderson
line: Asdana's White Oak? I think there might be a misunderstanding. We don't serve that here.

speaker: Boothill
line: No way. Are you sure you're not mistaken?

speaker: Anderson
line: If someone had reserved such a beverage, I would definitely remember it. It sells for hundreds of thousands of credits per bottle, after all... I couldn't afford to cover for such an item if it were broken or lost.

speaker: Boothill
line: That's strange... could it be that the Memokeeper couldn't afford it?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Then what should we do now?

speaker: Boothill
line: No need to rush. Let's grab some drinks first. Maybe I arrived too early and she hasn't come yet.

speaker: Boothill
line: Let's see what kind of juice malts you all have here... Well, give me a glass of Hinnom Valley 40 Years. I'll have it neat, no ice.

speaker: Anderson
line: Well, that's the most expensive one on the list. You have a taste for the finer things.

speaker: Boothill
line: Hah, it's on the house anyway...

speaker: Anderson
line: What can I get for you?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Anything you recommend is fine.

speaker: Anderson
line: Then I would recommend today's special, Glass Village — it's Classic SoulGlad mixed with Leboom juice. It's refreshing and suits your cool demeanor. Just one minute.

text: Soon, Anderson brings two cups of wine...

speaker: Boothill
line: Ahh! This flavor... Dynamite Barbecue with Rocket Fuel... It really hits the spot! Truly the finest sherry cask-aged malt juice in the cosmos.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: "Dynamite Barbecue with Rocket Fuel"... Is that really something that humans enjoy?

speaker: Boothill
line: Hey, this guy doesn't know anything at all.

speaker: Anderson
line: As long as you are satisfied, dear guests. Please enjoy.

speaker: Boothill
line: Let's give the Memokeeper another half system hour. If she doesn't show up, we'll need to come up with a new plan. In the meantime, let's take stock of the situation. What do you think?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The situation is unclear. Something must have happened on the Planet of Festivities, but the public is unaware of it. Someone in a position of power within The Family must be covering it up.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's unusual for the followers of the Harmony to invite other factions, let alone the IPC and the Masked Fools... If what you said about the Emanator of the Nihility is true, the situation in Penacony is... a little complicated, to say the least.

speaker: Boothill
line: Actually, there's something else I'm concerned about — regarding Acheron.

speaker: Boothill
line: As you know, the faction that follows the Path of The Hunt are some of the most dangerous folks in the Cosmos to mess with. I mean, who in their right mind would impersonate the Xianzhou Alliance or the Galaxy Rangers? It's like asking for a death wish...

speaker: Boothill
line: Isn't there a saying among the Xianzhou people that "the Reignbow sect lets their Lux Arrow do all the beating..."

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Talking. Do all the talking.

speaker: Boothill
line: Well, you know what I mean. Even though the Galaxy Rangers have been out of sight for years, we've been keeping an eye on this region. Even the dumbest criminals know better than to mess with the Annihilation Gang, much less the Rangers.

speaker: Boothill
line: But that Acheron lady... she doesn't seem like a lunatic at all. On the contrary, she's highly logical and organized. She knows exactly when to hold back and when to strike without mercy.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: And you believe that someone like her would have an ulterior motive for impersonating a Galaxy Ranger?

speaker: Boothill
line: I'm not entirely sure, but I do have my suspicions. Maybe she knows a Galaxy Ranger, or perhaps she's trying to lure us out for some reason... which I can't figure out.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Anyway, what worries me more are the anomalies within the Family. They've summoned followers from various paths for the festival. No matter how generous The Family might be, this move seems highly unusual.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Unless the invitations weren't sent by them. If that's the case, it's even more intriguing that The Family insists on organizing the Charmony Festival... despite the chaos.

speaker: Boothill
line: Maybe it's Xipe the Harmony pulling the strings. You find it beyond human understanding because it wasn't arranged by humans at all.

speaker: Boothill
line: People do stupid things out of irrational impulses. They abandon their principles when self-interest is involved. They believe in things they know they shouldn't, and fudge— they even break their own rules!

speaker: Boothill
line: But Aeons don't. THEY stick to their determined path and never turn back, even if THEY reach a dead end!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You think Xipe's will is behind all this?

speaker: Boothill
line: It may not necessarily be Xipe, but there's definitely some higher entity involved. I know it may sound pessimistic, but if human free will were reliable, why would we even need Galaxy Rangers?

speaker: Boothill
line: It's much simpler when you boil it down to the Aeons and Paths, like how Lan always follows the Path of The Hunt or how the Express stays true to the Trailblaze despite Akivili's disappearance.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But in my opinion, Akivili's fall holds significance for the Nameless.

speaker: Boothill
line: Oh? So you're saying the Nameless now have to take responsibility for their own choices because their "absolutely right" leader is gone?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Exactly. I believe the purpose of the journey isn't just about following a path that's always considered "absolutely right"...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's more about doing your best to choose the "right path" for yourself among countless possibilities, even with limited insight and judgment.

speaker: Boothill
line: I don't know what you've been through, but I agree that people must take responsibility for their choices, because no one else can do it for them.

speaker: Boothill
line: That's why the Galaxy Rangers need to uncover the impostor... and figure out her true intentions.

speaker: Boothill
line: Just in case, I have a backup plan if the Memokeeper doesn't show up... this is my final backup plan, I promise.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You sure have a lot of cards up your sleeve.

speaker: Boothill
line: Well, going back to my old career would make things a lot easier.

speaker: Boothill
line: By the way, when you were walking around the hotel, did you happen to see any... important-looking guests?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...What's your plan?

speaker: Boothill
line: It's simple. We just grab some hostages and use them as bargaining chips with The Family. Or maybe we can even take their identities...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: No need for that. We'll return to the Express now.

speaker: Boothill
line: Wait! Are you getting scared? Draw your weapon! Let's make a big scene!

speaker: Anderson
line: Are you leaving, esteemed guests? Would you like to cancel that Asdana's White Oak you just ordered?

speaker: Boothill
line: ...Huh? Asdana's White Oak? But didn't you just say...

speaker: Anderson
line: Looks like you are a bit intoxicated, esteemed guests. You ordered a bottle of Asdana's White Oak just a moment ago.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Looks like... your Memokeeper friend has finally arrived.

speaker: Boothill
line: ...Oh, right! Sorry, my memory's not the best. You know, too many modifications and all. Anyway, let me check... Well fork me... It's Asdana's White Oak alright, and there's a note...

speaker: Boothill
line: ..."I'll be waiting for you on the Astral Express."

speaker: Dan Heng
line: No mistake, that's her message to you. She knew the hotel wasn't safe, so she suggested we find another place.

speaker: Boothill
line: Well, looks like we took a detour, but now it's back to the Astral Express. So, what are we waiting for? Let's go!

speaker: Pom-Pom
line: You're back? Two guests just boarded, saying they were looking for Boothill, so I told them to wait in the Parlor Car.

speaker: Boothill
line: Oh! Just in time!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Two guests?

speaker: Pom-Pom
line: She's one of them. Look, we welcome all passengers on the Astral Express, but sneaking in like that... You have no regard for etiquette!

speaker: Black Swan
line: My apologies, conductor. It was an oversight on my part. I assumed you were already acquainted with the Garden... Given the chaotic situation in Penacony, the Nameless are the only ones we can truly trust right now.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You are the Memokeeper?

speaker: Black Swan
line: Pleased to meet you, Dan Heng. I've seen you in others' memories. And as for Boothill... This is our first face-to-face meeting. I hope you enjoyed that bottle of Asdana's White Oak. You sure have a refined taste.

speaker: Boothill
line: Finally, Memokeeper! Well, let's cut to the chase. Spill everything you know.

speaker: Black Swan
line: That's precisely what I intend to do. But before that, please allow me to introduce myself. My name is Black Swan, and I serve the Garden of Recollection as a Memokeeper. As for Acheron's story...

speaker: Black Swan
line: I'm sure she knows it better than I do.

speaker: Acheron
line: Greetings. I'm Acheron.

speaker: Boothill
line: What!? You Garden of Recollection shirtbag, you betrayed me!?

speaker: Acheron
line: I apologize, but she did that at my request. Due to certain... reasons, I have been exiled by The Family. Thankfully, this Memokeeper came to my aid and helped me escape their surveillance unnoticed.

speaker: Black Swan
line: To be honest, it was more like stalking than helping, and the process was far from "unnoticed"... But we did escape.

speaker: Acheron
line: I asked her to guide me to a place beyond The Family's reach and to contact a few trustworthy individuals, namely all of you.

speaker: Boothill
line: Trustworthy? Ha... hahahahaha! Son of a nice lady! You think I'm dumb or something?

speaker: Boothill
line: How about this? I'll put a few bullet holes in your head and see what secrets spill out, then we can talk about "trust"...

speaker: Acheron
line: It doesn't have to be like that. I'm willing to answer all your questions, but not right now... If my cover hadn't been blown, we might have had more time, but at the moment, we don't have any other options.

speaker: Boothill
line: No other options? What do you mean?

speaker: Acheron
line: This is the only way I can ensure everyone's safety...

speaker: Acheron
line: I kindly request an immediate warp jump out of the Asdana star system.

speaker: Pom-Pom
line: This passenger is requesting...

speaker: Black Swan
line: As far as I can tell, she's not a threat and seems to be telling the truth.

speaker: Acheron
line: I've briefly traveled with your companions and know their whereabouts, Dan Heng. Please rest assured, your Nameless companions are safe, but they need our help.

speaker: Acheron
line: As for Boothill, as you may have guessed... I've been waiting for you. Galaxy Rangers are known for their elusive nature and limited contact with each other, so this is the only way I could "reach out" to you.

speaker: Acheron
line: Only by doing this can I find a true Galaxy Ranger and fulfill a long-standing promise...

speaker: Acheron
line: ...To return "his" relics to their rightful owner.

speaker: Acheron
line: Someone once told me... that every rainfall is like a gift from the heavens, a sign of their mercy upon the world.

speaker: Acheron
line: Raindrops are said to be the tears of the Gods, shed in response to the sorrows of the world. Their constant pouring is a reminder that the Gods haven't abandoned us yet.

speaker: Acheron
line: So...

speaker: Acheron
line: How long has this rain been going on for?
I used to believe, just like you, that it would eventually stop. Years and decades passed... and in the end, such hope faded away before the rain did.
Looks like the God you mentioned doesn't exist after all.

text: As he spoke, the old man's gaze remained fixed on the distance. Amidst the fine drizzle of black rain, countless shadowy hands emerged from the sea, shrouded in an ethereal mist, reaching out towards the sky one by one.

line: Well, let me share a story with you...
Mortals who walk the Paths are like sailors on a vast ocean, leaving behind a trail that creates countless ripples of possibilities. These ripples last longer than the fleeting lifetimes of humans.
And for some, their presence leaves such a strong mark that it's reflected in the waves.

speaker: Acheron
line: Like... those shadows on the ocean.
Sin Thirsters... the obsessions of the Pathstriders. They emerge from the depths of IX, seeing themselves as masters of their own destiny, unknowingly repeating the actions of their past lives.
They emerge from the Nihility and head toward it, leading purposeless lives. However, these hollow phantoms...
...They were once my dear companions, a group of Galaxy Rangers.

speaker: Acheron
line: Are you watching over them?
Watching over them? No, I'm guiding them toward transcendence.

It was a brutal war, a crusade that shook the universe. The universe witnessed the fall of Zulo the Lord Ravager , but it came at a price... A price so hefty that only those who were there still remember.

The unwavering determination of The Hunt followers persists even in death, so someone must guide these lost souls to their life beyond. They were heroes in their time, and they shouldn't be reduced to mere puppets of the Nihility.
As for me... I've suffered too many losses on that battlefield to advance any further, and that makes me the most fitting person to carry out this task.

speaker: Acheron
line: But you know, these Sin Thirsters... They are not who they used to be.
Does this seem pointless to you?
Well, some tasks have to be done, even if they are pointless.

speaker: Acheron
line: I can help you.
For what?

speaker: Acheron
line: For the meaning of the Nihility... that's what I've been seeking.
...I see. After all, this realm is off-limits to ordinary souls, right?
Thank you, stranger. I wish that you find what you seek.

speaker: Acheron
line: Before we part ways, I have one more question...

speaker: Acheron
line: It is true that their actions and even their entire lives may seem pointless from our perspective, but if, and it's just an "if"...

speaker: Acheron
line: If this is what the departed ones expected, should we try to change it?
A good question, and a profound one... I don't know the answer.
What I do know is that one day, I too will pass away. I hope that when that day comes...
Someone will stand at my grave and place a bouquet of flowers.

text: Robin and Sunday decide to convince Gopher Wood , the Dreammaster, and their former benefactor — Hopefully, all goes well...
